report_title: Industry Report on Online Gambling Services
executive_summary: Online gambling services in the US are hosted on internet platforms which enable consumers to wager on events such as digital table games or other sporting events, including horse racing. This relatively small but robust industry has sought to capture more consumer demand for gambling services by branching out into hosting online platforms...

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Legalities and Limitations Vary State by State
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The legality of online gambling in the US is determined by the varying laws and regulations from state to state. For years, the Professional and Amateur Sports Protection Act (PASPA) of 1992 prevented states that had not already legalized online gambling within their borders from doing so, but this changed in 2018 when the Supreme Court struck it down, deeming it unconstitutional and allowing states to vote for themselves...

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Consumers Turned to Gambling Sites in Lockdown
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The industry proved to be relatively insulated from disruption thanks to the outbreak of COVID-19 in 2020. As these services are hosted online, online casinos let consumers who still wanted to gamble during the pandemic to do so from the comfort of their home, rather than risking the virus in public...

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Online Sports Betting as a Legal Workaround
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Supreme Court decision to overturn PAPSA in 2018 allowed states to make their own laws about sports betting. As of 2023, online sports betting is legal in 27 states and the number is growing...

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Online sports betting surged in popularity
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Online sports betting surged in popularity over the last five years thanks to a significant cultural shift. Thanks to the increasing ease and accessibility of online sportsbooks, sports betting has become more socially acceptable, particularly with younger demographics...

Sports betting and online gambling has become increasingly attractive to younger demographics because of their tech-savviness, penchant for digital experiences and the social aspect of betting. Influencers, especially in the sports and entertainment spheres, have played a pivotal role in promoting online gambling sites in the last few years...

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: MORE STATES WILL LEGALIZE ONLINE GAMBLING
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: More consumers in the US continue are embracing the industry, and the normalization of online gambling will lead to more states considering its legalization. As more states vote to legalize online gambling within their borders, online gambling companies will have an opportunity for growth...

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: COMPETITIVE PRESSURES IN NEWLY LEGALIZED STATES ARE HEATING UP
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: New entrants will compete with one another in newly legal regions, while established companies in states that have already legalized online gambling will continue to operate in protected markets...

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Established companies will have a competitive advantage
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Established companies will have a competitive advantage compared to new entrants in these states thanks to name recognition and experience...
As gambling companies invest in new employees, large marketing and promotional budgets, in addition to offering enhanced odds and sign-up, profit will falter...

It may be a bumpy ride, but the industry is expected to accelerate in the next few years as increasingly more states legalize online gambling, which will lead to overall increased revenue and participation nationwide...

Over the next five years, an increased amount of business will be conducted online, while the number of mobile broadband connections will also rise. This is a boon for the industry since the infrastructure necessary to provide consumers with more access to online gambling services is being built out...
As more consumers connect to the internet via mobile devices, mobile gambling taking place on smartphones is expected to rise...

The increasing accessibility of online gambling platforms has led to some concerns about addiction and problem gambling. While lobbyists in different states are pushing for legalization, the negative perception of gambling threatens to slow their progress...

industry_definition: Companies in this industry enable users to place bets online. These bets include digital table games and sports bets.

negative_impact_factors: Growth Life Cycle Stage - Low Imports, Low Customer Class Concentration, Low Product/Service Concentration

threats: Time spent on leisure and sports

key_trends: The Professional and Amateur Sports Protection Act (PASPA) of 1992 prevented states that had not already voted to permit legal online gambling from doing so. This changed in 2018 when the Supreme Court struck down PASPA as unconstitutional, opening the flood gates for states to vote on whether they should choose to permit online gambling within their borders.

The industry is subject to a heavy and steady level of regulation. Industry players operate in a tightly regulated environment as the legality of online gambling varies state to state. The industry receives no direct government financial assistance. The American Gambling Association is one of the few organizations that lobby in favor of the casino and gaming industries in the US.

Online gambling services primarily enable users to place bets online. These bets include digital table games, sports bets, poker and horse racing. The product mix for the industry is anticipated to change as more states legalize online gambling as a whole.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Consumers aged 29 and under are increasingly participating in the industry. This segment has experienced strong growth since the repeal of the Professional and Amateur Sports Protection Act (PASPA) in 2018.
As online gambling becomes increasingly accepted and practiced in social settings, this demographic is anticipated to drive the trend toward social and casual online gambling.
As online gambling becomes increasingly accepted and practiced in social settings, this demographic is anticipated to drive the trend toward social and casual online gambling.

This demographic remains important to the industry due to its high level of disposable income and large amount of leisure time. Technological advancement can be a major hurdle for users in this demographic.

This demographic remains important to the industry due to its high level of disposable income and large amount of leisure time. Technological advancement can be a major hurdle for users in this demographic.

products_and_services.product_description: Sports betting draws its popularity due to the ingrained importance of sports in American culture. Consumers watch sports as a form of entertainment, and sports betting can provide the consumer with additional entertainment and often increases the bettor's interest in the game.

The online gaming product segment consists of virtual offerings of traditional gambling offerings such as slot machines and table wagering games such as blackjack. Gambling machines are viewed as less high-risk than other gambling options and often enable consumers to play with a lower initial investment, boosting their popularity.

Poker is one of the most popular casino card games throughout the US and its popularity in an online format is no surprise. However, online poker is declining as a share of revenue and is currently legal in only six states.
The other product segment, which includes online horse racing and online state-run lotteries is anticipated to represent about 5.0% of industry revenue in 2024.

tier_2_suppliers: Internet Service Providers in the US
Data Processing & Hosting Services in the US
Security Software Publishing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The consumer confidence index measures how confident consumers are in the economy and their future expectations. As consumer confidence declines, consumers are expecting future conditions to deteriorate and will likely hold off on discretionary spending, minimizing demand for online gambling sites.

Consumer spending indicates the average level of consumption of goods and services in the US. When consumer spending grows, there is greater demand for industry services, leading to an increase in revenue.

The national unemployment rate measures the percentage of the labor force that is not employed. When unemployment rises, consumers are less likely to spend on discretionary goods, since their source of income has been diminished or cut off.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Time Spent on Leisure and Sports
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Time spent on leisure and sports measures free time that consumers have outside of work. As this measure increases, consumers have more time to spend on gambling or using other industry products and services, boosting industry performance.

business_locations.location_description: Flutter Entertainment has an estimated 16,813 employees in the US and accounts for an estimated 15.1% of total industry revenue.

New Jersey is currently the largest market for online gambling services in the United States, having first passed legislation on the topic in 2013. An influx of industry operators entered the state in 2018 with the repeal of PASPA.
Pennsylvania launched online sports betting, poker and casinos in 2019 with many major casino operators in the state rolling out online casino sites.

Nevada was the first state to allow online gambling, and currently has the second-largest number of establishments in the industry. Nevada was the only state which had widespread state-sponsored sports bettors at the time when PASPA became law and was exempt from the ruling.

regulations_points.regulation_title: LEGALIZATION OF ONLINE GAMING IS DETERMINED STATE BY STATE
regulations_points.regulation_description: Online gambling is legal in seven states, including Connecticut, Delaware, Michigan, New Jersey, Nevada, Pennsylvania and West Virginia. There are numerous laws on both the federal and state levels governing online gambling operations, including licensing requirements, tax structures, and restrictions on the types of games and bets that can be offered.

This law made it illegal to use wire communication facilities to transmit gambling information across state lines. In 2011 the Department of Justice released a legal opinion which decriminalized certain forms of gambling, stating the department will no longer seek criminal charges against those who play casino games online. As a result, several states legalized online casino games like poker, slot machines, bingo and the lottery.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE PROFESSIONAL AND AMATEUR SPORTS PROTECTION ACT (PASPA) OF 1992
regulations_points.regulation_description: The PASPA made it illegal for anyone in the United States to place bets on sporting events via the internet or other wire transfer methods. PASPA didn't outlaw sports betting because it was already illegal, but it prevented states from allowing it.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Revenue volatility level is very high, competition level is high and increasing, contributing to increased barriers to entry.
Online gambling is moderately labor-intensive as companies require skilled professionals like software developers, marketers, and customer service representatives.

basis_points.basis_title: High competition through mergers and acquisitions
basis_points.basis_description: The industry has a medium level of market share concentration. Through a series of mergers and acquisitions, Flutter Entertainment has grown to control the largest market share in the online gambling industry.

Concentration is limited by the differing restrictions on online gambling state by state. In New Jersey, operators are required to partner with a land-based casino to launch an online gambling service. In Michigan, each land-based casino operator can offer only one skin, or official extension of the brand, to potential online gambling operators.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The industry is relatively new and still evolving, allowing new operators to enter the market and compete with established companies.
The growing use of mobile and online technologies has made gambling on the go possible, increasing accessibility for consumers and operators.
The regulatory environment for online gambling in the US is complex and varies from state to state, which can make it difficult for new companies to navigate, limiting concentration.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Wage Costs Have Almost Doubled in the Last Five Years
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages are the most significant cost in the industry, accounting over 30.0% in 2024. This figure has grown significantly since 2019, when wage costs represented nearly half that.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Good Marketing is Key to Attracting Potential Consumers
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Marketing costs have slightly declined as a share of revenue in 2024.
Marketing is an important expense for companies since they must continuously attract online gamblers to use their platform to place bets rather than a competitor's.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Online gambling is moderately labor-intensive. This is because companies require a range of skilled professionals, like software developers, marketers, and customer service representatives, to design, develop, and maintain the online gambling platforms and provide customer support.

The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry. This creates an environment where the threat of new technologies driving disruption is low.

volatility_points.volatility_description: COVID-19 pandemic forced many physical casinos to shut down. As people sought entertainment options while stuck at home, online gambling grew in popularity.

Changes in state and federal regulations can impact the legality and profitability of online gambling companies. The industry is very susceptible to swings in revenue as more states legalize online gambling activities.

FAQs.question: What is the Professional and Amateur Sports Protection Act (PASPA) of 1992?
FAQs.answer: The PASPA effectively prohibited states from regulating and taxing sports betting themselves. In 2018, the Supreme Court issued a ruling that struck down the PASPA, permitting states to establish their own regulations for online betting.

FAQs.question: What is the Unlawful Internet Gambling Act (UIGA) of 2006?
FAQs.answer: The law prohibits online gambling websites from operating within the US in states that have not specifically legalized it. The law aims to prevent illegal online gambling activities, like money laundering, and to protect consumers from fraudulent or unscrupulous online gambling operations. The UIGA does not make it illegal for individuals to gamble online, nor does it specifically define what types of online gambling are illegal.

FAQs.question: What is the American Gaming Association (AGA)?
FAQs.answer: The AGA is a national trade group lobbies on behalf of the interests of the US casino and gaming industry, which includes online gambling. The AGA advocates for policies that support the industry and provides educational resources for its members.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Sales & Marketing: Diversified platforms will exhibit lower degrees of revenue volatility, aiding profitability. Non-diversified platforms will be more subject demand fluctuations, hindering profitability.

FAQs.question: Do sales depend on the health of the economy?
FAQs.answer: Sales & Marketing: While demand for industry products will depend on consumer confidence, some consumers cannot help themselves and will still demand gambling services when confidence declines. Most consumers will decrease spending on industry products during a period of weakened economic activity.

FAQs.question: Has your company sought growth through merger and acquisition activity?
FAQs.answer: Strategy & Operations: In protected geographic markets, oftentimes mergers are the only way to grow once the playing field becomes saturated. Companies that do not merge may be bought out.

FAQs.question: Is your company situated near downstream buying markets?
FAQs.answer: Strategy & Operations: Overall, companies must host servers in the state in which consumers are placing bets. It is illegal to place bets across state lines.

FAQs.question: Does your company invest in the latest technologies to establish a competitive edge over your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Technology: Companies that leverage mobile gaming will likley see market share rise. Companies they stick to current mediums may lose market share.

FAQs.question: How does your company leverage the newest technologies?
FAQs.answer: Technology: Operators who facilitate ease of access to their servers and games wil attract more customers and consumer dollars. Operators who do not adapt will see their traffic dwindle.

FAQs.question: Does the regulatory environment hinder your expanding of operations?
FAQs.answer: Compliance: The regulatory landscape will determine the distribution of server hosts. Legalizing online gambling in more states will allow revenue to accelerate.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all occupational health and safety requirements are upheld?
FAQs.answer: Compliance: Compliant server hosts will exhibit lower insurance premiums and costs, boosting profitability. Noncompliant server hosts will be subject to insurance cost increases, undercutting profitability.

FAQs.question: Has your company had any difficulty financing current operations?
FAQs.answer: Finance: Server hosts that enter into long-term provision contracts will have more stable revenue, enduring demand declines better and protecting against profit margin volatility. Oftentimes, industry operators will have negative profitability due to acquisition cost.

FAQs.question: How does your profit margin compare to those of your biggest competitors?
FAQs.answer: Finance: Server hosts that adopt the latest technologies will exhibit higher operating efficiencies. Server hosts that enter into extended contracts or agreements will exhibit lower revenue volatility and higher profitability.

FAQs.question: What regulations do you currently contend with? How have regulations affected your business?
FAQs.answer: Must comply with government regulations. Obtaining and holding a license is mandatory for operating in this industry.

FAQs.question: What new technology have you successfully adopted? Do you have plans to adopt other new technology?
FAQs.answer: Ability to quickly adopt new technology: Operators must be able to offer new and improved online games and interfaces to meet customer needs and ensure a high level of repeat patrons.

FAQs.question: What kind of promotional materials do you use? Have you been able to effectively promote your product?
FAQs.answer: Effective product promotion: It is essential to be able to effectively promote the online gambling service to attract patrons.

FAQs.question: Do you keep track of the consumer confidence index?
FAQs.answer: Consumer confidence index: As consumer confidence rises, individuals are more likely to spend on discretionary services, including online gambling.

FAQs.question: How have fluctuations in consumer spending affected your company in the past? Do you monitor changes in consumer spending? Do you find that consumers spend more in your establishment when consumer spending rises?
FAQs.answer: Consumer spending: As consumer spending rises, it demonstrates an increase in demand for goods and services. Should consumer dollars be spent on industry products, industry revenue performance will increase.

FAQs.question: Do you track the amount of time spent on leisure and sports? How do you mitigate the threat of declining leisure time?
FAQs.answer: Time spent on leisure and sports: The amount of time spent on leisure and sports is anticipated to fall in 2023.
